title: Simple Ways to Enable & Disable the Chrome PDF Viewer on PC and Mac

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It's near the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is near the bottom of the drop-down menu. A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Privacy and security.
steps.content: Click Privacy and security . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Site settings.
steps.content: Click Site settings . This is the last option.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Additional content settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Additional content settings . This is underneath the Content header, below Pop-ups and redirects . More options will expand below.

steps.title: Click PDF documents.
steps.content: Click PDF documents . A new page will open.

steps.title: Select Open PDFs in Chrome.
steps.content: Select Open PDFs in Chrome . When this option is enabled, Chrome will automatically display the contents of PDF files instead of downloading them to your computer. Restart Chrome to apply changes. If you'd rather use a different PDF viewer, disable Chrome's viewer .

steps.title: Click ⁝.
steps.content: Click ⁝ . It's near the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is near the bottom of the drop-down menu. A new page will open.

steps.title: Click Privacy and security.
steps.content: Click Privacy and security . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Site settings.
steps.content: Click Site settings . This is the last option.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Additional content settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Additional content settings . This is underneath the Content header, below Pop-ups and redirects . More options will expand below.

steps.title: Click PDF documents.
steps.content: Click PDF documents . A new page will open.

steps.title: Select Download PDFs.
steps.content: Select Download PDFs . When this option is enabled, any PDF file you click will be downloaded to your computer. When you open the downloaded PDF, it will open in your computer's default PDF viewer instead of Chrome. If you want to change your default PDF viewer, you can do so on Windows or on Mac .

steps.title: Click the menu.
steps.content: Click the menu. It's usually at the bottom-left corner of the screen. You can quickly change the default viewer by right-clicking any PDF and selecting Properties . Click Change… next to Open with . Click a new app, and then click OK .

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . It's on the left side of the menu.

steps.title: Click Apps.
steps.content: Click Apps . This is towards the middle of the window.

steps.title: Click Default apps.
steps.content: Click Default apps . It's in the left column.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Choose default apps by file type.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Choose default apps by file type . A list of file types will appear along the left side of the window, with each associated app on the right. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down to “.pdf.”
steps.content: Scroll down to “.pdf.” The current default viewer appears to the right of this entry.

steps.title: Click the default PDF reader.
steps.content: Click the default PDF reader. For example, if it's currently set to Google Chrome, click Google Chrome . A list of apps that can read PDFs will appear.

steps.title: Click the app you want to use.
steps.content: Click the app you want to use. The selected app will now open PDFs on your PC by default.

steps.title: Press Control as you click a PDF file on your Mac.
steps.content: Press Control as you click a PDF file on your Mac. This opens the menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Get Info.
steps.content: Click Get Info . The current default PDF reader appears next to “Open With” on this screen. For example, if Preview is set to open PDFs by default, that's what you'll see here.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu next to “Open With.”
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu next to “Open With.” A list of alternatives will appear.

steps.title: Click your preferred app.
steps.content: Click your preferred app. If you want to use Chrome, select Google Chrome . Or, to change it from Chrome, choose another option.

steps.title: Click Change All.
steps.content: Click Change All . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . The selected application will now open PDFs on your Mac by default.
